textBox.richText: Richard Simmons would be proud! If yesterday’s walk wasn’t challenging enough then we sure were in for a treat today! Our task (and we chose to accept it) was to walk the famous Mist Trail alongside Vernal Fall to enjoy a mid morning snack at Emerald Pool and the Silver Apron. The Mist Trail, as the name implies, is a rather wet walk up the side of the waterfall along 600 granite steps! The strenuous slippery walk was well worth the effort to see a great view of Vernal falls. The look back down the valley wasn’t half bad either. Following our decent we drove to Glacier point to find a great sunny spot for lunch. This provided a beautiful panorama of the park including Half Dome, North Dome and a selection of snow-capped peaks far in the distance. We also managed a bear sighting at the carpark toilets. Obviously he didn’t mind the stench from the composting loos which we will both be glad to see the end of! The day concluded with a flat 4km walk to Taft point - a view of over 7000 feet above sea level testing our fear of heights. The highlight of the day had to be hitting the hotel spa - our legs and buns never felt so good!
